meanings.definition: Speak in a formal manner to an audience.
meanings.sent1: During the school play, the main character orates his lines clearly and confidently.
meanings.sent2: The politician orates passionately about the importance of education.
meanings.sent3: The cat orates to the birds outside, hoping they will come closer for a chat.
meanings.sent4: The sun orates its warmth to the flowers, coaxing them to bloom beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The teacher orates the lesson, making sure every student understands.

meanings.sent1: The student orates about his favorite book in front of the class.
meanings.sent2: The CEO orates at the company's annual meeting to inspire the employees.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel orates to the other animals about the benefits of storing nuts for winter.
meanings.sent4: The river orates its journey through the valleys, telling stories of the lands it has touched.
meanings.sent5: The coach orates a motivational speech before the big game to boost the team's spirits.
